TopicTitle: Can someone please fix the alien nostromo for 1.02

Articles.Content: can someone please just fix this and bring this up to 1.02, im lacking the skills and the knowledge or i would do it myself, i loved this mod before and would love if could be updated for everyone to use [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12477-0-21-1-Alien-Nostromo-%28ver-1-3-7%29](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12477-0-21-1-Alien-Nostromo-%28ver-1-3-7%29)

Oh WOW... this mod is SOO outdated that i could faint.

why you want this old mod anyways??

Looks like a lovely old craft. But in the absence of any sort of licence in the download or anywhere in that thread, nobody apart from the author is really allowed to update the model or code, sorry. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

A quick except :

> 
> A custom plugin is required (Nost\_pluginModule.dll, included in the download package) for the engine switching as well as for the animated landing gear. Make sure to move the file to the plugin directory within the KSP directory. Source code has been included

yup there is custom animations... and source code is included.
I would love to fix it for myself to use but i lack the knowledge to fix it so i mean if i can find someone that can just fix it and email it to me privately, it wouldn't be a license issue would it?

I looked into the source code and I think it doesn't do complicated stuff. The major problem still is that there's no license. Without it only the mod author is allowed to modify anything. A MM patch definitely isn't enough to fix the mod.

Unfortunately the mod author isn't active in this forum for almost 2 years. The chance is very slim that he'll return. Maybe you can ask him somehow through Dropbox to add a license.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-26T02:52:51Z" title="06/26/2015 02:52  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 26, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**

> 
> EDIT- @ sumghai That mean we can't even write patches for them ?

You can write patches, but you can't modify and/or redistribute the original mod itself with your patch.

Technically the (US) copyright will expire 70 years after the author's death, or 95 years from the date of creation if he/she never reveals his/her legal name. So in about 2107 you could distribute the patch along with the mod. That might be a teensy bit longer than it would take to develop a similar mod from scratch.

Apologies for the confusion, guys, but to clarify:

 - Yes, you can make a patch for the Nostromo mod right now

 - However, the patch must be offered ***separately*** from the original mod itself (i.e. you need to tell other people to download the original Nostromo mod before getting your patch)

 - You cannot ***directly*** bundle the old mod with your patch for the sake of convenience (as the ARR licence prohibits that)

It doesn't matter if it's for "private use" or "a few people" - you need to obey the licence on the original work. Therefore:

 - You can *link* to the original (broken) mod and distribute *only* the MM patches needed to fix it

 - You cannot redistribute a new version of the mod as a single package
